intro: Knautia arvensis var. mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritanian knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and a compact, bushy growth habit. This variety is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
